gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਪ੍ਰਿਅ ਭੇਟਤ ਅਧਾਨ ਨਿਰਮਾਨ ਹੋਤ ਬਾਂਛਤ ਬਿਧਾਨ ਖਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਅਗ੍ਰਭਾਗਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Pria Bhaytat Adhaan Niramaan Hota , Baanchhat Bidhaan Khaan Paan Agrabhaagi Hai ?
translation: As a wife presents herself to her husband with humility and becomes pregnant, the husband brings her all the foods of her liking and taste.

gurmukhi: ਜਨਮਤ ਸੁਤ ਖਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਕੋ ਸੰਜਮੁ ਕਰੈ ਸੁਤ ਹਿਤ ਰਸ ਕਸ ਸਕਲ ਤਿਅਾਗਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Janamat Sout Khaan Paan Ko Sanjamu Karai , Sout Hit Ras Kas Sakal Tiaagi Hai ?
translation: On birth of a son, she abstains from eating all that may be harmful to the child.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਕਾਮਨਾ ਪੁਜਾੲਿ ਨਾਮ ਨਿਹਕਾਮ ਧਾਮ ਅਨਤ ਨ ਲਾਗਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Taisay Gur Charan Sarani Kaamanaa Pujaai , Naam Nihakaam Dhaam Anat N Laagi Hai ?
translation: Similarly taking the refuge of the True Guru with devotion; the desires of a Gursikh are fulfilled. He is blessed with the Naam by the True-Guru which is the source of desirelessness. One craves for nothing more and observes no rituals.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਸਿ ਅੰਧਕਾਰ ਭਵ ਸਾਗਰ ਸੰਸਾਰ ਬਿਖੈ ਪੰਚ ਤਸਕਰ ਜੀਤਿ ਸਿਖ ਹੀ ਸੁਜਾਗਿ ਹੈ ||੧੭੯||
transliteration: Nisi Andhakaar Bhav Saagar Sansaar Bikhai , Panch Tasakar Jeeti Sikh Hee Sujaagi Hai ?179?
translation: A Sikh who has received the boon of elixir-like Naam can win over the five evils cautiously and swims across worldly ocean that is frightening like a dark night. (179)
